Docs.summary: Specifies constants that define actions performed by the mouse.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MouseAction enumeration specifies constants which correspond to actions performed by the mouse, such as F:System.Windows.Input.MouseAction.RightClick?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True and F:System.Windows.Input.MouseAction.RightDoubleClick?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.
MouseAction can be used with a T:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True to create a input gesture which can be bound to a command using a T:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For more information about commanding, see the [Commanding Overview](../Topic/Commanding%20Overview.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to construct a T:System.Windows.Input.MouseGesture?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True using a MouseAction and how to bind the gesture to a T:System.Windows.Input.RoutedCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True using a T:System.Windows.Input.MouseBinding?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.
